Description: Neck sherd of Milesian pre-Fikellura or Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: glaze fired red-brown; bottom of lip glazed, above elaborate maeander square pattern between lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The curvature of the top of the sherd is consistent with that of an oinochoe, not a neck-amphora, as identified by Venit. The pattern is found on pre-Fikellura and later Fikellura oinochoai, see British Museum 1864,1007.149 ( which Cook placed in his Plain Body Group) for a pre-Fikellura oinochoe and Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 4, no. 36 for a later one. Listed as an amphora by Venit.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 43, no. 156 pl. 38)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.107)
